tags.name: SAML applications
tags.description: SAML applications enable Single Sign-On (SSO) integration between Logto (acting as Identity Provider/IdP) and third-party Service Providers (SP) using the SAML 2.0 protocol. These endpoints allow you to manage SAML application configurations.

post.description: Create a new SAML application with the given configuration. This will create both the application entity and its SAML-specific configurations.

name.description: The name of the SAML application.

description.description: The description of the SAML application.

attributeMapping.description: Mapping of SAML attributes to Logto user properties.

acsUrl.description: Service provider assertion consumer service URL configuration.

201.description: The SAML application was created successfully.

400.description: Invalid request body or SAML configuration.

delete.description: Delete a SAML application by ID. This will remove both the application entity and its SAML-specific configurations.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the SAML application to delete.

204.description: The SAML application was deleted successfully.

400.description: Invalid application ID, the application is not a SAML application.

404.description: The SAML application was not found.
